1627703143_17NZ2BiZ1HUYppUcUmU5bgyGkp8kH.body: Can you make a script for MacOS? Your script doesn't work on Mac for some reason.

1632925044_19TrKZA9ifR8bvPbL64AbNqttCDkW.body:
_“ZeroNet” is damaged and can’t be opened. You should move it to the Trash._

It doesn't open on Mac OS.

> [saqat](#comment_7_14NiXkEXrFAHokAohyiCv5PCAXLcEsvEUp): Anyone mind explaining what this is to a newcomer?

It's a version of ZeroNet patched for TORv3. For Mac and Linux, TOR still has to be installed no matter which version of ZeroNet you use.

1624835115_129GZPA7VpPa3YaRRW2ani34CaowY.body:
> [7uz8yu7gxwnhfgae](#comment_6_1CN7STVMU29Rme1tgVRRPj3ZA3H7m99Rei): (meh) Zeronet would be fine if it just kept working. There are sections of Zeronet which do move lots of traffic. they don't need much help from anyone. But I'd argue that one of the things holding Zeronet back with the lesser used sites is that it lacks a single "I want to seed everything" button. The decision to omit that function was insane.

Open the right-side panel to seed all optional files.
